title: Sales Dashboard
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Data Filters Key Performance Figures Data Performance Table The Dashboard has been broken down into 3 sections. Data Filters NOTE: If a field is left blank this will automatically choose all options available. NOTE: The search will only return up to the number of lines of data as configured in Analysis Configuration. If your search exceeds the limit a notification will display. From Date Pick a Start Date. To Date Pick an end Date. Shops Choose from your set list of shops. Vendor Select specific or all vendors available. Shop Group Choose a group of selected shops. Company This can be used if a Tenant has multiple companies within Imagine. Hierarchy This is to narrow down a category as required by only one level. Clerks Use to narrow down to a specific Clerk member or all Clerks available. Customer Select a specific customer or a collection of specific customers. Type Choose between Sale or Return. Receipt Use the saved receipt number to narrow it down to a particular sale/return. NOTE: All other filters will be ignored when using the Receipt Number filter Group by Columns Used to group data into summary rows based on the number of columns you pick. For example if you pick 1,2 then, after you press Submit, the data will be grouped by the left most column and then by the second left column and you will see one row for each combination. This can be beneficial where you are planning on viewing large data sets and wish to see summary information initially. To see detailed grouping you should use the 'Drag column header' feature explained in Grouping Categories. NOTE: When pressing Submit you may receive a warning about invalid group column, you should adjust the left most columns to valid entries. Saves Reports, this will also save the format you have configured. Resets the filters to default values This will fetch the data *if available. To review past saved reports. See My Analysis for more details. Key Performance Figures These are static boxes of overall information from the data shown in the Data Performance Table. SalesSales Ex TaxTaxQtyCostDiscountProfit Overall figure for sales within the table. The overall figure for Sales Excluding Tax Total Tax figure from the data in the table overall. Overall Quantity of items generated within the data. Overall costing of outgoings that are not sales through the till (e.g., postage) Overall discount applied across all sales. Overall Profit figure Data Performance Table The table shows the data of which information you have selected from the fields above, you can modify the way the information is displayed. Search Use the Search Bar to find data in the table below Show Local Currency Columns Allows local currency columns to show in the Column Chooser. Local currency columns will be denoted by a * such as Tax* Export All Data This will export the data to a .xlxs file for use. There is no option to print directly from this page. Column Chooser This will bring up a list of options to add or remove columns. Reset Grid Filters Resets any filters applied to the Data table
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Data Filters
  • Key Performance Figures
  • Data Performance Table

The Dashboard has been broken down into 3 sections. 

Data Filters

NOTE: If a field is left blank this will automatically choose all options available.

NOTE: The search will only return up to the number of lines of data as configured in Analysis Configuration. If your search exceeds the limit a notification will display.




From Date
Pick a Start Date.
To Date
Pick an end Date.
Shops
Choose from your set list of shops.
Vendor
Select specific or all vendors available. 
Shop Group
Choose a group of selected shops.
Company
This can be used if a Tenant has multiple companies within Imagine.
Hierarchy
This is to narrow down a category as required by only one level.
Clerks
Use to narrow down to a specific Clerk member or all Clerks available.
Customer
Select a specific customer or a collection of specific customers.
Type
Choose between Sale or Return.
Receipt
Use the saved receipt number to narrow it down to a particular sale/return.
NOTE: All other filters will be ignored when using the Receipt Number filter
Group by Columns
Used to group data into summary rows based on the number of columns you pick. For example if you pick 1,2 then, after you press Submit, the data will be grouped by the left most column and then by the second left column and you will see one row for each combination. This can be beneficial where you are planning on viewing large data sets and wish to see summary information initially.
To see detailed grouping you should use the 'Drag column header' feature explained in Grouping Categories.
NOTE: When pressing Submit you may receive a warning about invalid group column, you should adjust the left most columns to valid entries.


Saves Reports, this will also save the format you have configured.
Resets the filters to default values
This will fetch the data *if available.
To review past saved reports. See My Analysis for more details.

Key Performance Figures

These are static boxes of overall information from the data shown in the Data Performance Table.



SalesSales Ex TaxTaxQtyCostDiscountProfit
Overall figure for sales within the table.The overall figure for Sales Excluding TaxTotal Tax figure from the data in the table overall.Overall Quantity of items generated within the data.Overall costing of outgoings that are not sales through the till (e.g., postage)Overall discount applied across all sales.Overall Profit figure


Data Performance Table

The table shows the data of which information you have selected from the fields above, you can modify the way the information is displayed. 


SearchUse the Search Bar to find data in the table below
Show Local Currency Columns
Allows local currency columns to show in the Column Chooser. Local currency columns will be denoted by a * such as Tax*
Export All DataThis will export the data to a .xlxs file for use. There is no option to print directly from this page.
Column Chooser


 This will bring up a list of options to add or remove columns.

Reset Grid Filters
Resets any filters applied to the Data table

title: Grouping Catagories
text: To group data in the Sales Data Performance Table, follow these steps: Click and hold the header you want to group by (e.g., "Shop"), and drag it into place. If you want to remove a column header from the grouping, perform the reverse action by dragging it from its position and dropping it back into the table where you want the header to be placed. Notes The table will automatically update as you add, remove and alter positions of the headers. Headers placed furthest to the left will automatically be the major grouping, whilst headers further to the right will be subsequently more minor groupings. The example below explains this in more detail. Columns that display variable digital denominations, large blocks of text and other limitations cannot be grouped. You will not be able to drop these headers in the 'drag and drop' area. In Sales examples of the headers that cannot be grouped are: Cost Sales Qty Tax Profit Example of grouping with a single column: Once you group the data, the Data Performance Table will display the information in a different format, showing the groups. In this case, it will be grouped by "Shops." You can use the arrow next to each shop's name to expand and view more detailed information. Example of grouping with multiple columns: If you choose multiple headers to group by, you will have a stack of groups. For example, you may have "Shops" as the major header, and within each shop, you can further group by "Date". To change the hierarchy of the data, arrange the groups in the desired order. The data will stack based on the order of the groups you arrange with major priority to the left, moving to minor priority as you move to the right.
description:
To group data in the Sales Data Performance Table, follow these steps:


Click and hold the header you want to group by (e.g., "Shop"), and drag it into place. 

 

If you want to remove a column header from the grouping, perform the reverse action by dragging it from its position and dropping it back into the table where you want the header to be placed.


Notes

The table will automatically update as you add, remove and alter positions of the headers.

Headers placed furthest to the left will automatically be the major grouping, whilst headers further to the right will be subsequently more minor groupings. The example below explains this in more detail.

Columns that display variable digital denominations, large blocks of text and other limitations cannot be grouped. You will not be able to drop these headers in the 'drag and drop' area. In Sales examples of the headers that cannot be grouped are:

  • Cost
  • Sales
  • Qty
  • Tax
  • Profit



Example of grouping with a single column:


Once you group the data, the Data Performance Table will display the information in a different format, showing the groups. In this case, it will be grouped by "Shops." You can use the arrow next to each shop's name to expand and view more detailed information.



Example of grouping with multiple columns:

If you choose multiple headers to group by, you will have a stack of groups. For example, you may have "Shops" as the major header, and within each shop, you can further group by "Date". To change the hierarchy of the data, arrange the groups in the desired order. The data will stack based on the order of the groups you arrange with major priority to the left, moving to minor priority as you move to the right.

title: Saving a Report
text: When saving a report, please keep the following points in mind: Saving a report does not save the data itself; it only saves the formatting and configuration of the report. To save your created report, click on the "Save This Report" button. A pop-up window will appear. In the pop-up window, you can provide a name for your report. It is recommended to choose a descriptive name for easy future reference. There is an option for setting the report's visibility or permissions: "No One": Only you will be able to see this report. "My Role": Other members with the same role as you will have access to this report. "Everybody": Anyone with access to reporting will be able to see this report. Click the save button within the pop-up to save the report along with the chosen settings. After saving, you will receive an on-screen notification confirming that the report has been successfully saved. NOTE: You can save multiple versions of the same report with the same name. They will not replace or stack on top of each other. Each saved report will be distinct and separate.
description:
When saving a report, please keep the following points in mind:

  • Saving a report does not save the data itself; it only saves the formatting and configuration of the report.
  • To save your created report, click on the "Save This Report" button. A pop-up window will appear.



In the pop-up window, you can provide a name for your report. It is recommended to choose a descriptive name for easy future reference.


There is an option for setting the report's visibility or permissions:

  • "No One": Only you will be able to see this report.
  • "My Role": Other members with the same role as you will have access to this report.
  • "Everybody": Anyone with access to reporting will be able to see this report.

Click the save button within the pop-up to save the report along with the chosen settings.

After saving, you will receive an on-screen notification confirming that the report has been successfully saved.


NOTE: You can save multiple versions of the same report with the same name. They will not replace or stack on top of each other. Each saved report will be distinct and separate.

title: Recalling a Saved Report
text: To view a previously saved report, follow these steps: 1. Click on the "Show Saved Reports" button. 2. A pop-up window will appear on the page, presenting a list of saved reports. Select the report you want to open. 3. After selecting the report, click the "Submit" button to retrieve the associated data. 4. Saved reports are categorized based on the share option chosen when saving. The available categories are: "Saved Reports": This category displays reports saved under any of the three share options. "Shared Reports": This category shows reports saved with the "Everybody" or "My Role" share options. In the pop-up window, you will find the following information for each saved report: Description: The name given to the report at the time of saving. Share Type: The chosen share option when saving the report. Created: The date when the report was initially saved. Modified: The date when any changes were last made to the saved file. Type of Report: Indicates the type of report that was saved, such as Sales or Customer. Additionally, you have the following options for each saved report: Edit: Allows you to edit the report's name and share type. Delete Deletes the report. A confirmation message will appear asking you to confirm deletion with options to choose "Yes" or "No."
description:
To view a previously saved report, follow these steps:


1. Click on the "Show Saved Reports" button.


2. A pop-up window will appear on the page, presenting a list of saved reports. Select the report you want to open.



3. After selecting the report, click the "Submit" button to retrieve the associated data.


4. Saved reports are categorized based on the share option chosen when saving. The available categories are:

  • "Saved Reports": This category displays reports saved under any of the three share options.
  • "Shared Reports": This category shows reports saved with the "Everybody" or "My Role" share options.


In the pop-up window, you will find the following information for each saved report:

  • Description: The name given to the report at the time of saving.
  • Share Type: The chosen share option when saving the report.
  • Created: The date when the report was initially saved.
  • Modified: The date when any changes were last made to the saved file.
  • Type of Report: Indicates the type of report that was saved, such as Sales or Customer.

Additionally, you have the following options for each saved report:


Edit: Allows you to edit the report's name and share type. 
Delete Deletes the report. A confirmation message will appear asking you to confirm deletion with options to choose "Yes" or "No."
